gurmukhi: Aink AnUp rUp rUp smsr nwNih AMmiRq kotwin koit mDur bcn sr
transliteration: Anik Anoop Roop Roop Samasar Naanhi , Anmrit Kotaani Koti Madhur Bachan Sar ?
translation: Many other beautiful forms may be there but none can reach near the effulgent form of the beloved True Guru nor millions of elixir-like items can reach the sweet words of the True Guru.

gurmukhi: Drm ArQ kpit kwmnw ktwC pr vwr fwrau ibibD mukq mMdhwsu pr
transliteration: Dharam Arad Kapati Kaamanaa Kataachh Para , Vaar Daarau Bibidh Moukat Mandahaasu Par ?
translation: I sacrifice all four desires of life over a look of grace of my True Guru. I can sacrifice myriad salvations over a sweet smile of my True Guru. (Dharam, arth, Kaam and mokh are paltry over the smile and look of grace of the True Guru).

gurmukhi: s√çrg AnMq kot ikMcq smwgm kY sMgm smUh suK swgr n qul Dr
transliteration: Svarag Anant Kot Kinchat Samaagam Kai , Sangam Samooh Soukh Saagar N Tul Dhar ?
translation: Comforts of millions of heavens cannot match even a momentary meeting with True Guru and comforts on total meeting with Him are beyond the capacity of oceans.

gurmukhi: pRym rs ko pRqwp sr kCU pUjY nwih qn mn Dn srbs bilhwr kr ]646]
transliteration: Praym Ras Ko Prataap Sar Kachhoo Poojai Naahi , Tan Man Dhan Sarabas Balihaar Kar ?646?
translation: No one can reach the glory and loving elixir of the True Guru. I sacrifice my body, mind and wealth unto Him.  (646)
